#Text=Wikinews interviews German music video director Uwe Flade
#Text=Wednesday , March 26 , 2008
#Text=Uwe Flade is a music video director from Germany .
#Text=He has worked with numerous artists , including Depeche Mode , Rammstein , Apocalyptica , In Extremo , Nickelback , Franz Ferdinand and Tarja Turunen .
#Text=Wikinews conducted an exclusive email interview with him , available below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Tell us about your work , and how you came to be involved with directing .
#Text=What stands out about you , and what inspires you ?
#Text=I was into music videos for a while already , watching MTV for hours every day .
#Text=Back in the 90ies it was very inspiring and exciting to discover all those new visual styles and watch people like Gondry , Glazer , Jonze , Mike Mills rising .
#Text=I was then trying to set up a little film production company around 99 after being stuck in some office jobs at TV stations and other production companies .
#Text=I shot a few little things and got the chance to pitch an idea to a friend who played in a rising German band .
#Text=They took the concept and I directed my first video .
#Text=It was a tough ride but the video got some airtime .
#Text=The next jobs didn´t roll in easily but it was the genre I loved so I was fighting hard which got me more and more jobs .
#Text=I am collecting ideas all the time and I can´t really tell what inspires me .
#Text=Sometimes taking a shower makes my mind work , sometimes I would just sit in front of my computer until the idea hits me .
#Text=Travelling to places I haven´t been also often inspires me a lot .

#Text=How has the advent of the Internet — and the switch at networks ( such as MTV ) from almost exclusively music videos to original programming — changed the way that artists approach what they want from a music video ?
#Text=Has the " big budget " music video disappeared ?
#Text=The big budget hasn´t disappeared completely but the number of artist spending a lot is much smaller now and the budgets in general went down a lot .
#Text=YouTube changed a lot too .
#Text=The hypersuccessful homemade style video for Ok Go " here it goes again " was a landmark for this development .
#Text=It got over 31 000 000 views on YouTube and counting , won lots of prizes and got a lot of press .
#Text=So the homemade , handmade style since then is a big thing in music videos turning the budget shortage in creativity .
#Text=Some years ago Fatboy Slims " praise you " was an outsider , now it is a big part of the whole picture .
#Text=I think the artists just want to look good on the videos , that comes first ever since .

#Text=Some of them still want something original happening but with the generally shrinking budgets a new style had to appear to squeeze creativity out of the mostly very limited money available and actually the artists don´t have a choice .
#Text=Is it difficult to make a planned plot for a video fit the music and the short time on offer ?
#Text=For me it is a challenge and still the freedom of creativity in this genre is a blast .
#Text=I learned so many things by just trying them out and playing around with them .
#Text=Your credits span across many artists and genres .
#Text=What 's it like working with such a broad range ?
#Text=It is a great broadband , I was thrilled by the very different demands and characters I met so far .
#Text=I personally like to do different styles just to keep creativity running and being challenged instead of repeating the same receipy over and over again .
#Text=Which of your works would you say you enjoyed working on the most ?
#Text=Besides the big international projects for Depeche Mode I enjoyed a lot to work with my friends Sportfreunde Stiller .
#Text=I shot 10 videos for them and it is even harder to work for long term friends since the fear to fail is much more personal .
#Text=Were there any projects that you did n't enjoy making ?
#Text=Hmmmm .
#Text=There are some ; - )
#Text=Do you have anything new in the works at the moment ?
#Text=I am setting up a mixed media collective of designers , animators and directors and planning a short film .
#Text=Do you find commercial pressures , such as ensuring videos are not subject to censorship or filming deadlines , conflict with your interests as an artist ?
#Text=Actually I am feeling challenged by those things more then annoyed .
#Text=The band and label pay for the whole thing so they set up the limits which is totally fine for me .
#Text=The TV censorship in Germany is not very strict and I don´t have so much experience with these things in the United States .
#Text=I saw some rules for US TV , very long lists of things to care for .
#Text=My videos didn´t really break those rules anyway but there are a lot ...
#Text=that´s what I thought .
